title: Spain through to semis after win over hosts Switzerland
summary: Spain continue their quest for a first European Championship crown by scoring two second-half goals to knock out hosts Switzerland and reach the semi-finals.

title: How two moments of brilliance helped Spain beat Switzerland
summary: Alex Scott, Steph Houghton, Nikita Parris and Anita Assante analyse how two brilliant goals helped Spain beat Switzerland to reach the semi-finals of Euro 2025.

title: Hosts Morocco cruise past Mali to reach Wafcon semis
summary: Ibtissam Jraidi's double helps the Atlas Lionesses to a 3-1 win, setting up a last-four meeting against either Algeria or Ghana at the Women's Africa Cup of Nations.

title: England 'optimistic' Williamson will play in semi
summary: England are "very optimistic" that Leah Williamson will play against Italy in their Euro 2025 semi-final, says fellow defender Esme Morgan.

title: Leeds agree Â£17m deal for Germany midfielder Stach
summary: Hoffenheim midfielder Anton Stach is set to sign a four-year contract at Elland Road.

title: I hadn't packed, but it wasn't our time to go - Morgan
summary: England defender Esme Morgan discusses making her Euro 2025 debut in the victory over Swede.

title: London City sign goalkeeper Poor on permanent deal
summary: Newly promoted Women's Super League side London City Lionesses sign goalkeeper Sophia Poor on a permanent transfer.

title: Man Utd new boy Leon catches eye in draw with Leeds
summary: Young full-back Diego Leon impresses during Manchester United's 0-0 draw with Leeds in their pre-season friendly.

title: Arsenal name two 15-year-olds in Asia tour squad
summary: Arsenal include 15-year-olds Max Dowman and Marli Salmon in their squad for their tour of Singapore and Hong Kong.

title: England have built togetherness through vulnerability - Mead
summary: England forward Beth Mead tells BBC Sport's Jo Currie how opening up to each other during tough times has helped the Lionesses build trust and togetherness on and off the pitch.

title: Howe confident 'happy' Isak will stay at Newcastle
summary: Newcastle are beaten 4-0 by Celtic in their first pre-season fixture, with striker Alexander Isak left out of the Magpies squad.

title: Rashford's big move - from unwanted at Man Utd to wanted by Barcelona
summary: With Marcus Rashford set to leave Old Trafford, BBC Sport explains how he ended up on the brink of a remarkable move to Barcelona.

title: 'What a stupid thing to do' - Germany go a goal and a player down
summary: Germany's Kathrin Hendrich is sent off for pulling the hair of Griedge Mbock after a VAR review. Grace Geyoro scores the resulting penalty to put France 1-0 up in the Women's Euro 2025 quarter-final.

title: Berger's stunning save prevents extra-time own goal
summary: Germany goalkeeper Ann-Katrin Berger acrobatically keeps out a headed deflection to deny France a goal in the first half of extra time in the Women's Euro 2025 quarter-final in Basel.

title: Berger stars as Germany reach semi-final on penalties
summary: Goalkeeper Ann-Katrin Berger plays a crucial role as Germany recover from an early red card to beat France on penalties in the Women's Euro 2025 quarter-final in Basel.

title: Berger's journey from cancer to shootout hero
summary: Ann-Katrin Berger was Germany's hero as she made two decisive saves in a penalty shootout as they defeated France in a chaotic quarter-final at Euro 2025.

title: Golden Boot winner to substitute - England's Mead on role 'shift'
summary: England forward Beth Mead's role at Euro 2025 is a very different one to the one she enjoyed three years ago.

title: Pressure & better keepers - why penalties are being missed at Euro 2025
summary: The penalty shootout between England and Sweden at Euro 2025 will go down as one of the most dramatic in football history - but it was not an outlier at the tournament. BBC Sport investigates why spot-kicks are being missed.

title: Gabriel says things will be 'different' at Arsenal 'after letting titles slip'
summary: Arsenal defender Gabriel Magalhaes says "things will be different" this season after missing out on the Premier League title again.

title: England stand with Carter against racist abuse - Bronze
summary: Lucy Bronze says England "want to stand up and make a change" in solidarity with Jess Carter, who has revealed that she's been experiencing "a lot of racial abuse" during Euro 2025.
